The amount of money you should put into a trust fund for your child's education expenses will depend on various factors, such as the cost of education, your financial goals, and your investment strategy. Here are some things to consider:

1. Estimate the cost of education: You may want to consider estimating the cost of education for your child, factoring in tuition fees, room and board, books, and other expenses. 2. Determine your financial goals: Think about how much you can afford to contribute to the trust, and what your goals are for your child's education. Will you be covering all educational costs, or are you only providing a portion of the expenses? 3. Consider your investment strategy: Depending on when your child will need the funds, you’ll need to consider the investment strategy that would best fit the time frame before expenses arise. Some plans offer tax-efficient strategies for education. 4. Consult with a financial advisor or an estate planning attorney: An experienced financial advisor or an estate planning attorney can help you weigh your options and decide how much you should contribute to the trust fund based on your unique circumstances. It is important to create a well-defined and well-structured plan because it can give you a desired outcome for investment decisions being made over the years. It's always useful to start planning earlier, as having more time can offer more flexibility in investment choices and timing of contributions.
